Pattern Change Detection Results

Understanding Your Results

Detection Rate: The percentage of pattern changes you correctly noticed. Higher is better. 100% means you detected every change.

Mean RT (Reaction Time): How fast you responded after a change occurred, in milliseconds. Lower = faster detection.

Correct Detections: Pattern changes you successfully noticed and responded to.

Misses: Pattern changes that occurred but you didn't detect in time.

False Alarms: Responses during baseline (before any change occurred).

Run-by-Run Data

Each row is one run (baseline deviation response). "Dev. Rep" = when deviation occurred. "RT" = time from deviation to response.

About the Export Files

JSON file: Contains ALL your data including settings, every event with timestamps, and responses. Best for detailed analysis or importing into other software. Can be loaded back as a preset.

CSV file: A spreadsheet-friendly format with one row per event. Opens in Excel, Google Sheets, or any data analysis tool. Good for quick charts and statistics.

Both files include: trial numbers, timing data, stimulus parameters, response types, and reaction times.
